hanzi-su-wiki:
剛

Значения

Твердый, крепкий

Мнемоника

Горы 山, словно сетью 网 покрытые снегом, где добывают руду для изготовления мечей 刂 особой прочности.

Варианты

刚
purpleculture_pinyin:
gāng
hard; firm; strong; just; barely; exactly
жесткий; твердый; сильный; только; едва; точно
rtega_mnemonic:
剛剛RS
刚刚		hard, tough, rigid, strong
  • knife 刂 cutting through mountains and mist 岡/冈 alike: hard and strong
  • ⓢ controlling 乂 the wilderness 冂, I just reach the ridge of the hill 冈. It is hard as a knife 刂.
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 刚)
Antonyms: 柔
Pictophonetic: 岡 indicates the sound; 刂 (knife) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
剛才 [ gāng cái ]: just now; a moment ago
剛纔 [ gāng cái ]: (just) a moment ago
剛好 [ gāng hǎo ]: just; exactly; to happen to be
剛性 [ gāng xìng ]: rigidity
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 岡 [ gāng ] ridge or crest of hill
    • 刂 [ dāo ] knife
heisig_chinese_memo: Talking on the phone - Just now a mountain goat attacked me but I had my saber to scare it off.
koohiiStory1: Mount everest is very sturdy, you can hit it all day with a saber and it wont even wobble.
koohiiStory2: Anything sturdy in Japan is associated with Mount Fuji. Perhaps this is because it´s symmetry is believed to make it rather sturdy itself, unlike all those crooked mountains that are around and tend to fall apart (think rock slides, avalanches, etc.). Here we see Sturdy-brand sabers with Mount Fuji engraved on the blade.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A hill knife is the most sturdy knife you can find.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: The reason hill knives are so sturdy is because they are shaped like hills. Very wide, very thick, not so long. So, they don't break and are more sturdy.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: This sturdy (but strangely shaped) knife is used by ごういち.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine ごういち rolling the knife back and forth over various things to cut them. "I love my sturdy hill knife," he says.
Ru_Words:
内剛外柔ないごうがいじゅう
  • мягок с виду, но крепок духом
    • 剛の者ごうのもの
  • силач, богатырь; мастер чего-л, закалённый и бывалый
    • 剛情ごうじょう
  • упрямство
    • 金剛石こんごうせき
  • алмаз
Ru_Radicals: 并, 冂 (перевёрнутая коробка), 刈 (косить), 山 (гора), 岡 (холм)
Ru_trainchinese:
gāng: (нареч) только что, только; как раз
gāng: (нареч) точно, как раз
gāng: (прил) жесткий, колючий; сильный, крепкий
Kanshudo_mnemonic: a hill (岡) sword (刂) would be sturdy
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Just now, the news reports, the mighty saber was found stuck in the ground at the ridge of wolverine hill.
humanum_full_description_en: Oracle from " sword " to " net ", " net " is the original text of " net ", the whole character is like a knife to cut the shape of the net, to show the meaning of strength. "Shuowen": "Strong, strong cut. From the sound of the sword. 𠇙, the ancient Chinese is just like this." See " net ". The oracle bone inscriptions represent the sacrifice of the sacrifice of animals with a knife, and the inscriptions on the inscriptions on the bones of the bones represent sturdiness. It is found in Shiqiangpan (see Yu Haoliang) and is also used as a name. It is also known as " Gang ", which means hills, and Sanshi disc: "Zhigang (Gang)" means climbing on hills.
humanum_short_description_en: Oracle starts with " knife " from " net ", " net " is the original text of " net ", the whole character is like cutting the net with a knife to show strength.
humanum_full_description: 甲骨文從「刀」從「网」，「网」是「網」的初文，全字象以刀割斷網之形，以示彊力之意。《說文》：「剛，彊斷也。从刀岡聲。𠇙，古文剛如此。」參見「网」。甲骨文表示以刀斷牲之祭，金文表示堅強，見於史牆盤(參于豪亮)，又用作人名。又通假為「岡」，表示山岡，散氏盤：「陟剛(岡)」，表示登上山岡。
humanum_short_description: 甲骨文從「刀」從「网」，「网」是「網」的初文，全字象以刀割斷網之形，以示彊力之意。

Chinese Definition: Antonyms: 柔

  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 岡 [ gāng ] ridge or crest of hill
    • 刂 [ dāo ] knife
①硬，堅強，與“柔”相對：剛強。剛直。剛烈。剛勁(姿態、風格等挺拔有力)。剛健。剛毅。剛決。剛正不阿。剛愎自用。
②恰好，恰巧：剛剛(a。恰好；b。才)。剛好。
③才：剛纔。剛來就走。
④姓氏。

甲骨文從「 刀 」從「 网 」，「 网 」是「 網 」的初文，全字象以刀割斷網之形，以示彊力之意。《說文》：「剛，彊斷也。从刀岡聲。𠇙，古文剛如此。」參見「 网 」。甲骨文表示以刀斷牲之祭，金文表示堅強，見於史牆盤(參于豪亮)，又用作人名。又通假為「 岡 」，表示山岡，散氏盤：「陟剛(岡)」，表示登上山岡。
Oracle from " sword" to " net", " net" is the original text of " net", the whole character is like a knife to cut the shape of the net, to show the meaning of strength. "Shuowen": "Strong, strong cut. From the sound of the sword. 𠇙, the ancient Chinese is just like this." See " net". The oracle bone inscriptions represent the sacrifice of the sacrifice of animals with a knife, and the inscriptions on the inscriptions on the bones of the bones represent sturdiness. It is found in Shiqiangpan (see Yu Haoliang) and is also used as a name. It is also known as " Gang", which means hills, and Sanshi disc: "Zhigang (Gang)" means climbing on hills.

剛字的基本解释

剛
gāng
见“刚”。

剛字的汉语字典释义

[①]［gāng］
［《廣韻》古郎切，平唐，見。］
“刚1”的繁体字。
(1)坚硬。
(2)刚直；倔强。
(3)强盛；健旺。
(4)肃杀。
(5)勉强。
(6)古代哲学家用阴阳概念来解释自然界两种对立和相互消长的势力，认为阳性剛，阴性柔。因以“剛”指：（1）“阴阳”之阳。参见“剛柔”。（2）“晝夜”之昼。昼为阳，夜为阴。参见“剛柔”。（3）“奇偶”之奇。奇为阳，偶为阴。参见“剛日”。（4）“君臣”之君。君为阳，臣为阴。《易·鼎》：“玉鉉在上，剛柔節也。”高亨注：“君上爲剛，臣民爲柔。節，有節度也。”
(7)副词。才。
(8)副词。偏；只。
(9)副词。恰好，正好。
(10)钢。铁和碳的合金。
(11)通“犅”。公牛。
(12)鼓名。
(13)兵车名。
(14)星名。即天罡。北斗七星之柄。
(15)姓。元有刚僧，清有刚毅、刚林。

剛字的康熙字典解释

【子集下】【刀字部】　剛； 康熙笔画：10； 页码：页141第11
〔古文〕???【唐韻】古郞切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】居郞切，?音岡。【說文】彊斷也。从刀，岡聲。【增韻】堅也，勁也。【易·乾卦】大哉乾乎，剛健中正。【司馬光·潛虛】剛，天之道也。又作㓻。【史記·樂書】而民㓻毅。

剛字的源字形

字源演变：

甲骨文金文小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
剛字的起名意思

暂无。

just
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［gāng］
["Guangyun" Gu Langqie, Ping Tang, see you. ]
Traditional characters for "刚1".
(1) Hard.
(2) Upright; stubborn.
(3) Strong; healthy and prosperous.
(4) Killing.
(5) Reluctantly.
(6) Ancient philosophers used the concept of yin and yang to explain the two opposing and ebb and flow forces in nature, thinking that the masculine is strong and the feminine is soft. Because "rigid" refers to: (1) "Yin and Yang" of Yang. See "rigid and soft". (2) "Day and night" day. Day is yang, night is yin. See "rigid and soft". (3) The oddness of "odd-even". Odd is yang, even yin. See "Gang Ri". (4) The prince of "princes and ministers". The king is yang, and the minister is yin. "Yi·Ding": "Yu Xuan is on the top, and the festival is rigid and soft." Gao Heng's note: "The king is strong, and the subjects are soft. Festival, there is a degree of flexibility."
(7) Adverbs. only.
(8) Adverbs. Partial; only.
(9) Adverbs. Exactly, exactly.
(10) Steel. An alloy of iron and carbon.
(11) Link "X". bull.
(12) The name of the drum.
(13) The name of the vehicle.
(14) Star name. That is Tiangang. The handle of the Big Dipper.
(15) Last name. There is a strong monk in the Yuan Dynasty, and a strong and strong forest in the Qing Dynasty.

gāng
вм. 刚
Radicals: 岡, 刂  (hill, knife)
Meaning Mnemonic
A hill knife is the most sturdy knife you can find.
The reason hill knives are so sturdy is because they are shaped like hills. Very wide, very thick, not so long. So, they don't break and are more sturdy.
Reading Mnemonic
This sturdy (but strangely shaped) knife is used by ごういち.
Imagine ごういち rolling the knife back and forth over various things to cut them. "I love my sturdy hill knife," he says.
